At least in the U.S. military, you can’t have already served in a foreign military to serve. It’s a policy you find out about with a little bit of research before joining. You also can’t have been part of the Peace Corps, either. Not sure if these are waiverable requirements, however. I imagine the U.S. would still want to recruit anyone that has valuable skills if they can also be proven trustworthy and physically/mentally qualified, but really, if you know someone high enough you could probably get away with just about anything.

Yes, From the continent of North America the British Army accepts applicants from Canada and many Caribbean countries that are part of the British Commonwealth. Usually that have to have lived in the UK for 5 years before applying but these rules occasionally get bent. We don’t take people from the middle bit of that continent though.
